instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.PPBUS_3GH: What is PPBUS_3GH? PPBUS_3GH is a typo of PPBUS_G3H. If you see someone type PPBUS_3GH assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Red Light no Fan spin
threads.message:
Dear Administrator,

I have a board with minor liquid damange. 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_3GH</SIGNAL> is present. 

F7140  = 8.6

<CHIP>U5110</CHIP> 
Pin 1 = 3.42
Pin 2 = 0
Pin 3 = 3.42
Pin 4 = 2.8
Pin 5 = 3.3
Pin 6 = 3.4
Pin 7 = 3.42
Pin 8 = 3.3

Liquid damange I made some foto's looks like DDR Power supply chip is damange. But I dont get so far yet.

I can't find any short.

Hope to hear from you.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Red Light no Fan spin
threads.message:
Clean the corrosion as best as possible.
Be sure about components and traces.

Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS?
Do you note pulse at any big coil?
